1.option_desc:
Prinz Eugen messaged me to come to the maid café.
Today, before closing time, Nürnberg found a strange slip of paper under a tray on a table.
The paper was wet and the writing stained, but you could just about make out the words, "come" and "afar."
Essex, who arrived on the scene, determined based on the ink's splotchiness that it was written sometime after the ship's departure today.
How she reached this conclusion, I'm not sure... but her detective outfit strangely lends her an air of credibility.
1.option_desc_2: A wet note was found under a tray in the maid café. The only legible words on it were "come" and "afar."
option_desc_display: Eugen guides me to the table where the incident took place.
Today, before closing time, Nürnberg found a strange slip of paper under a tray on this table.
The paper was wet and the writing stained, but you could just about make out the words, "come" and "afar."
Essex, who arrived on the scene, determined based on the ink's splotchiness that it was written sometime after the ship's departure today.
How she reached this conclusion, I'm not sure... but her detective outfit strangely lends her an air of credibility.
There are no more clues to be gained here. It's time to go somewhere else.
1.title: A Note Under the Tray

2.option_desc:
In the onboard garden, I spotted Bristol looking around.
I looked thoroughly under her light, and she was right – someone left some conspicuous footprints here.
Bristol also pointed out how the soil's humidity was different from the rest and insisted on investigating further.
2.option_desc_2: Something left a roughly 30 centimeter big imprint on a bush in the onboard garden.
option_desc_display: She points to a thicket among the trees and asks, "Don't you think that looks suspicious?"
Shining her lantern on it, I look and see that something has carved a gap straight through the middle of the otherwise orderly bushes. It's about 30 centimeters big.
"They weren't brushed aside," she tells me while feeling the ground, "they were crushed! Look at the ground! There are trampled branches, too!"
I look thoroughly under her light, and she's right – someone has left some conspicuous footprints here.
Bristol also points out how the soil's humidity is different from the rest and insists on investigating further.
I tell her in no uncertain terms to not study the soil by tasting it, then entrust the garden investigation to her.
There are no more clues to be gained here. It's time to go somewhere else.
2.title: The Crushed Bushes

3.option_desc:
As I was passing by the gym, I heard the scraping of a heavy object being dragged along the floor.
Just as I considered leaving, I heard the sound again. Upon closer inspection, it was coming from further inside the gym.
I immediately ran in to check and nearly slipped on a puddle. Then I turned a corner and literally bumped into Essex.
We decided to clean up the place so nobody else would slip.
I offered her a drink at the balcony bar for her hard work, but she politely turned me down, citing wanting to focus on her investigation.
3.option_desc_2: Strange sounds like a heavy object being dragged have been in various places around the gym.
option_desc_display: It's midnight, and the gym is empty. There are no people, of course, but also no cargo carts in sight.
I wonder if what I heard was just noise from some machine and consider leaving, but then I hear the sound again.
Upon closer inspection, it's coming from further inside the gym.
I run toward the source of the noise to see what it is, and I nearly slip on a puddle of water in the corridor.
Before I can regain my balance, someone enters the corridor and they, too, slip on a puddle.
"Oh no! Look out!" were Detective Essex's last words immediately before she slammed into me.
Since it's clearly a tripping hazard, she and I decide to wipe the floor.
I offer her a drink at the balcony bar for her hard work, but she politely turns me down, citing wanting to focus on her investigation.
That's enough for one day. It's time to rest.
3.title: Noise in the Gym

4.option_desc:
I got a message from Lung Wu to come to the central kitchen.
Apparently, she and her Empery friends were making breakfast baozis when they noticed the container with the stuffing inside had disappeared.
I called the security room and got the surveillance camera footage. It turned out that the container was placed just out of sight of the camera.
Somehow I'm not surprised at all.
4.option_desc_2: A container full of freshly-cut meat stuffing vanished in the blink of an eye from the kitchen.
option_desc_display: "It's gone!" she explains, "The stuffing I just made for our meat buns is all gone!"
Apparently, she and her Empery friends were making breakfast baozis when they noticed the container with the stuffing inside had disappeared.
"I worked hard on that stuffing!" she elaborates, "It was all meat, too! I looked away for just an instant, and then it was gone!"
"All that's left is the dough. Without stuffing," she says with anger, "the only thing I can make is steamed buns, dammit!"
I call the security room and get the surveillance camera footage. It turns out that the container was placed just out of sight of the camera.
Somehow I'm not surprised at all.
That's all the clues I'm getting out of this place. It's time to visit a different location.
4.title: The Stolen Stuffing

5.option_desc:
Newcastle contacted me, urging me to come to the banquet hall's food storage.
She told me that the food to be served at tomorrow's Royal Maid tea party had been stolen.
The extent of the damage wasn't that severe, but the perpetrator clearly had very particular targets in mind.
Everything with meat in it was missing, so were some things without meat, but everything with vegetables in it was still here.
I called the security room and got the surveillance camera footage. The camera there malfunctioned at the time of the crime, leaving a gap of about 10 seconds.
This didn't come as a surprise to me whatsoever.
5.option_desc_2: The food storage in the banquet hall was looted. Primarily food that contains meat was stolen.
option_desc_display: She tells me that the food to be served at tomorrow's Royal Maid tea party has been stolen.
My examination reveals that the extent of the damage isn't that severe, but the perpetrator clearly had very particular targets in mind.
Everything with meat in it is missing, so are some things without meat, but everything with vegetables in it is still here.
I call the security room and get the surveillance camera footage. The camera here malfunctioned at the time of the crime, leaving a gap of about 10 seconds.
This doesn't come as a surprise to me whatsoever.
That's all the clues I'm getting out of this place. It's time to visit a different location.
5.title: The Ransacked Fridge

6.option_desc:
Both the previous two incidents involved food. The place with the most food on board is without a doubt the warehouse.
The door was still sealed shut and the lock was intact. There was no sign that anyone used an unlawful method to get in.
I called the security room and got the surveillance camera footage. This time, there was no blind spot or temporary outage.
The cameras perfectly covered each and every angle of the warehouse, and there was no sign of any theft.
6.option_desc_2: The warehouse, despite having more food than anywhere else on the ship, has gone completely unscathed.
option_desc_display: The door is sealed shut and the lock is intact. There's no sign that anyone used an unlawful method to get in.
I call the security room and get the surveillance camera footage. This time, there's no blind spot or temporary outage.
The cameras perfectly cover each and every angle of the warehouse, and there is no sign of any theft.
My scrutiny reveals nothing. The manager of the warehouse never reported anything unusual in the first place, but I wanted to be sure.
That's all the clues I'm getting out of this place.
Then, Bristol shoots me a message. I decide to head to the mystery room and meet up with the other investigators.
6.title: The Untouched Warehouse

7.option_desc:
Fu Shun and I came to cabin quarter A in order to investigate a lead she had found.
According to her info, one can hear a perfectly disciplined set of footsteps as midnight approaches. Nobody has ever seen the cause of these footsteps.
Time passed by little by little. We waited with bated breath.
Then, we heard the tapping of footsteps from in the corridor.
Fu Shun screamed before rushing in the direction of the sound, but nobody was in the corridor. The footsteps faded, too.
We contacted security to check the surveillance cameras, and there was no footage of anyone else going through the corridor.
7.option_desc_2: Mysterious footsteps can be heard from a corridor near the cabins late at night.
option_desc_display: According to her info, one can hear a perfectly disciplined set of footsteps as midnight approaches. Nobody has ever seen the cause of these footsteps.
"It's a ghost! This must be the work of a ghost!" Fu Shun excitedly swings her camera about.
Time passes by little by little. We wait with bated breath.
Then, we hear the tapping of footsteps from in the corridor.
"Get back here! I'm not letting you get away!" Fu Shun screams, before rushing in the direction of the sound.
But nobody's in the corridor. The footsteps have faded, too.
We contacted security to check the surveillance cameras, and there's no footage of anyone else going through the corridor.
Could it really be a ghost, after all?
7.title: Footsteps in the Night

8.option_desc:
Detective-journalist Alfredo Oriani contacted me, and we met up at cabin quarter B.
She excitedly showed off a photo. The background was dark, save for a single pale figure looming in the corner.
Based on the room numbers in the background, it must have been taken in cabin quarter A. The pale figure definitely looked realistic, too.
This is an extremely valuable clue. It might be related to the footsteps that have been heard in the corridor at night.
After giving Alfredo my sincere compliments, I deposit the photo in my file.
8.option_desc_2: Alfredo Oriani got a picture of a ghost in one corridor.
option_desc_display: Alfredo excitedly shows off a photo. The background is dark, save for a single pale figure looming in the corner.
"Heheheh, I put Aoba through the wringer to get this secret scoop! The Sakura Empire's too good at this stuff~ Isn't this an awesome photo?" Alfredo smugly pushes up her sunglasses.
Based on the room numbers in the background, this must have been taken in cabin quarter A. The pale figure definitely looks realistic, too.
This is an extremely valuable clue. It might be related to the footsteps that have been heard in the corridor at night.
After giving Alfredo my sincere compliments, I deposit the photo in my file.
There don't seem to be any more clues around. Time to check elsewhere.
8.title: Spirit Photography

9.option_desc:
When I went through the corridor of cabin quarter C, I saw Essex skulking around.
She claimed that she was just in the middle of investigating rumors of an inescapable corridor.
The rumors say that when two people enter the corridor late at night, they may never leave again.
She pulled me by the hand and ran toward the corridor, yet we couldn't go through. When I checked the room numbers, we'd been returned to where we came from.
In the end, we manage to get out of the corridor just fine. I think the rumors were a little exaggerated.
9.option_desc_2: In one corridor, a thick fog appears and disorients people passing through.
option_desc_display: From behind their cloak, I hear a panicked voice. "H-hold on! Why do you look like you're ready for a fight?!" It's Detective Essex.
She claims that she was just in the middle of investigating rumors of an inescapable corridor.
The rumors say that when two people enter the corridor late at night, they may never leave again.

"I was going to call Shangri-La and have her come here, but since you wandered in, we have everything we need! It's time to figure out whether this rumor holds any water or not!" Detective Essex pulls me by the hand and runs toward the corridor.
As we approach the door, the fog around us thickens.
While I wonder to myself why there's fog in a cruise ship, Essex and I pass through what should've been the door to the corridor.
Yet we couldn't go through. When I check the room numbers, we've been returned to where we came from.
"The rumors were true?! Commander, let's try walking in opposite directions this time!" Essex excitedly runs forward, so I turn to go the other way.
In the end, we manage to get out of the corridor just fine. I think the rumors were a little exaggerated.
9.title: The Inescapable Corridor

10.option_desc:
When I passed by the movie theater, I heard a scream followed by several small explosions.
I went inside and found three people: Elizabeth curled up in a ball and quivering, Belfast trying to console her, and Sheffield on alert.
I investigated and found that the projector had been destroyed by gunfire, stopping the movie.
Detective Essex said the film was from Casablanca's precious collection, so Bristol asserted that Casablanca was the perpetrator.
However, she was outnumbered four to one, and was forced to give up on her theory.
10.option_desc_2: When Elizabeth was watching a comedy movie, it suddenly turned into a horror movie.
option_desc_display: I go inside and find three people: Elizabeth curled up in a ball and quivering, Belfast trying to console her, and Sheffield on alert.
Elizabeth explains the situation, still shaking like a leaf, "We were watching a comedy movie, and it turned into a horror movie out of nowhere! Servant, investigate this!"
I investigate and find that the projector has been destroyed by gunfire, stopping the movie.
I go to the projection booth and find the film amidst the wreckage.
Detective Essex came running as soon as she'd heard the news. "This film is from Casablanca's precious collection! It's a good thing it isn't damaged... She'd cry for days."
Bristol, who'd also come running, already had a theory brewing. "I know! Casablanca must have caused this!" However, Fu Shun and Emanuele immediately and vehemently disagree.
Outnumbered four to one, Bristol is forced to give up on her theory.
No more clues here. Time to check elsewhere.
10.title: The Switched Film

11.option: (Strike while the iron is hot. Barge in.)
11.option_desc:
Emanuele Pessagno called me about a serious crisis that unfolded at the Sardegnian bath party.
A short while ago, the Sardegnian shipgirls found that the pizzas they'd made for their party had pineapple slices on it.
"All of the pizzas we made for tonight! Every single one! All pineappled!" Trieste emotionally added.
"Umm... I think pineapple on pizza is pretty good," said Detective Essex, who took a bite of pizza and clearly liked it.
I dragged her out of the baths before things could escalate further.
11.option_desc_2: When the Sardegnian girls were partying, their pizzas all had pineapples on them.
option_desc_display: When I throw open the door, one furious Trieste, wearing only a towel, explains what happened.
A short while ago, the Sardegnian shipgirls found that the pizzas they'd made for their party had pineapple slices on them.
"All of the pizzas we made for tonight! Every single one! All pineappled!" Trieste emotionally adds.
Alfredo wastes no time. She rushes to the scene and takes pictures, all the while wiping her tears. "It's a huge scoop, but I can't even be happy about it!"
"Umm... I think pineapple on pizza is pretty good," says Detective Essex, who had likewise rushed here. She takes a bite of pizza. "Mmm, tasty!"
After making the excuse that we have more important things to investigate, I drag Detective Essex out of the baths before things can escalate further.
11.title: The Pineappled Pizza

12.option_desc:
As we walked by the mall, Essex suddenly said she wanted to go in and buy souvenirs.
As soon as we went in, Essex found her mark – a giant octopus plushie.
When we finished paying, the automatic cash register spat out money – the exact price of the plushie. Seeing this, Essex gleefully grabbed the biggest shopping bag in sight.
I tried to stop her from taking advantage of an obvious mistake, but Essex pointed at the store's sign, which said, "Akashi's Holiday Toy Store."
In the end, Essex did much "shopping."
12.option_desc_2: When I went shopping with Essex, the register started giving us money.
option_desc_display: When we go in, Essex has already found her mark – a giant squid plushie.
Surprised at how quickly she'd made her decision, I get ready to buy the plushie for her. But then, something unexpected occurs.
When we finish paying, the automatic cash register spits out money – the exact price of the plushie.
"Wait, the register paid us? Not the other way around? This is a huge win! Commander, let's buy everything in this shop!" Essex gleefully grabs the biggest shopping bag in sight.
I try to stop her from taking advantage of an obvious mistake, but Essex points at the store's sign. It says "Akashi's Holiday Toy Store."
In the end, Essex did much "shopping."
12.title: The Rampaging Register
